content: Shuang Hao - The University of Texas at Dallas Shuang Hao Home Publications Media Students Teaching Awards Service Shuang Hao Associate Professor Department of Computer Science Erik Jonsson School of Engineering & Computer Science University of Texas at Dallas Office: ECSS 3.705 Phone: (972) 883-4164 Email: shao -at- utdallas.edu Google scholar I am an Associate Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Texas at Dallas. My research interests are in security and privacy, particularly developing data-driven and AI techniques to identify and mitigate adversarial attacks and illicit activities. My current work focuses on AI security, big data security, and security of next-generation network systems. I am a recipient of the NSF CAREER Award (2022), IETF Applied Networking Research Prize (ANRP 2020), IEEE/IFIP DSN Best Paper Award (2020), IMC Best Paper Award Runner-up (2019), CSAW Best Applied Security Paper Award Finalist (2022, 2017), and Yahoo! Key Scientific Challenges Program Award (2012). My research has been featured in media outlets, including MIT Technology Review, Slashdot, WIRED, New Scientist, Fortune, CNN, and The Wall Street Journal. I completed my undergraduate study at Tsinghua University. I obtained my Ph.D. in Computer Science at the Georgia Institute of Technology advised by Prof. Nick Feamster. I also worked closely with Prof. Vern Paxson at the University of California, Berkeley/ICSI. Before joining the University of Texas at Dallas, I was a postdoc at the University of California, Santa Barbara working with Prof. Giovanni Vigna and Prof. Christopher Kruegel. RA positions available I am looking for self-motivated PhD students who have strong interests in artificial intelligence and cybersecurity research.
